item.title: Starlink Gets India License to Start Services, Official Says
item.description: Elon Musk’s Starlink Inc. has got regulatory approval in India, paving the way for rolling out its satellite internet services in the world’s most-populous country.
item.dc:creator: Santosh Kumar, Shwetha Sunil

media:content.media:description: A Starlink Inc satellite-internet communication system antenna on the roof of a home in Accra, Ghana.

item.title: The SEC Pinned Its Hack on a Few Hapless Day Traders. The Full Story Is Far More Troubling
item.description: When a notorious gang of Ukrainian cybercriminals hit a crucial database, the regulator quickly downplayed the breach. One of the hackers says the system is still a soft target.
item.dc:creator: Liam Vaughan

item.title: Indonesia’s Sovereign Fund Weighs Role in Grab-GoTo Deal
item.description: Indonesia’s sovereign wealth fund Danantara is considering a role in Grab Holdings Ltd.’s planned $7 billion acquisition of GoTo Group, potentially allowing the country’s government to own a slice of an Asian internet powerhouse.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Poh, Elffie Chew, Manuel Baigorri

media:content.media:description: A Gojek driver in Jakarta. Photographer: Dimas Ardian/Bloomberg

item.title: Bond Traders Consult Risk Bosses Daily to Prep for Next Storm
item.description: The turmoil that hit markets after Donald Trump’s Liberation Day tariffs may have faded, but the aftershocks roll on in the risk departments of some of the world’s biggest banks.
item.dc:creator: Alice Atkins

item.title: Hong Kong’s Platform for $166 Billion Pension Faces Glitches
item.description: Some Hong Kong pensioners migrating to a new electronic system for retirement savings have experienced glitches, raising concerns over the platform’s reliability as it enters a key phase of adding more users.
item.dc:creator: Shawna Kwan, Lulu Yilun Chen, Echo Wong

media:content.media:description: Hong Kong. Photographer: Peter Parks/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: HSBC’s Private Bank Turns Overweight US Stocks on AI Hopes
item.description: HSBC’s private banking arm has gone overweight US stocks and neutral on those in Europe, flipping its view from earlier this year after a breezy round of earnings from US tech companies.
item.dc:creator: Joanne Wong

media:content.media:description: Signage outside the HSBC Holdings Plc headquarters building in Hong Kong. Photographer: Chan Long Hei/Bloomberg

item.title: London’s Fintech Woes Spread as Wise Shifts Main Listing to US
item.description: Wise Plc just fired the latest warning shot for British bankers and lawmakers trying to get more IPO prospects to choose London — particularly in the fintech sector.
item.dc:creator: Aisha S Gani

media:content.media:description: Taavet Hinrikus

item.title: N26 Eyes New Round to Offer Partial Exit for Coatue, Third Point
item.description: German digital bank N26 is considering a new funding round at a reduced valuation that could allow some of its existing investors including Coatue Management, Third Point and Dragoneer Investment to recoup part of their investment, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Eyk Henning, Arno Schuetze, Crystal Tse

media:content.media:description: German internet bank N26 advertisement in Berlin, Germany, in 2021.

item.title: HelloFresh Executives Face Growing Dissent Over Pay Ahead of AGM
item.description: HelloFresh SE’s management could be edging closer to a revolt on executive pay after failing to heed investors’ warnings for the last three years.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Shiltagh

media:content.media:description: A HelloFresh mealkit.

item.title: Kuaishou’s Shares Climb After Outlining Video AI Revenue Jump
item.description: Kuaishou Technology’s stock climbed to its highest level since March after the social video service said it expected annual revenue from video-generation platform Kling AI to hit $100 million by February.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Zheping Huang

media:content.media:description: The Kuaishou Technology website. Bloomberg

item.title: Stonepeak Is Said in Exclusive Talks for Buyout of $2.1 Billion Yinson
item.description: Stonepeak Partners is in exclusive talks for a buyout of Yinson Holdings Bhd. that may value the firm at as much as 9 billion ringgit ($2.1 billion), according to people with knowledge of the matter, in what could be one of the biggest deals in Malaysia this year.
item.dc:creator: Elffie Chew

media:content.media:description: The Tun Razak Exchange (TRX) financial district in Kuala Lumpur, left, and other buildings in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia on Sunday, Jan. 14. 2024. Malaysia is scheduled to release it's annual gross domestic product (GDP) figures on Jan. 19. Photographer: Richard Humphries/Bloomberg

item.title: Burning Trees for Electricity Isn't Sustainable
item.description: Continued support for Drax Group will only make sense if the UK government can detail a better vision — and execute it.
item.dc:creator: Lara Williams

media:content.media:description: Clearing the air.

item.title: BYD’s Misfire With Price Cuts Sparks $20 Billion Stock Selloff
item.description: A renewed EV price war launched by BYD Co. has shaved more than $20 billion off its market value in just two weeks, as skepticism over the top Chinese automaker’s strategy takes some steam out of its big rally.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: Musk Walks Back Threat to Decommission Dragon Spacecraft
item.description: Elon Musk seemingly backed down from a threat to decommission SpaceX’s Dragon spacecraft that ferries cargo and people to the International Space Station for the US, made during an escalation of a spat between the billionaire and President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Loren Grush, Sana Pashankar

media:content.media:description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket and Dragon spacecraft in Merritt Island, Florida.

item.title: Elon Musk’s Feud With Trump Spurs One of His Worst Wealth Losses Ever
item.description: Minute by minute, post by post, Elon Musk’s very public, extremely online feud with President Donald Trump sliced into his vaunted status as the world’s richest person.
item.dc:creator: Dylan Sloan, Tom Maloney

item.title: Defense Startup Anduril Clinches Funding at $30.5 Billion Valuation
item.description: Anduril Industries Inc. has closed a new funding round of $2.5 billion, a deal that more than doubles the defense startup’s valuation to $30.5 billion, Executive Chairman Trae Stephens said in an interview on Bloomberg Television.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: The Anduril Fury, an autonomous air vehicle, in Avalon, Australia.

item.title: Meituan to Expand Drone Delivery Routes Over Dubai Marina
item.description: Meituan is expanding its drone delivery service in Dubai as part of an ambitious overseas push.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding, Stephen Engle

media:content.media:description: Meituan's Keeta food delivery drone during a demonstration in Hong Kong on June 5. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

item.title: Broadcom Gives Tepid Forecast, Missing Loftiest Expectations
item.description: Broadcom Inc., a chip supplier to companies like Alphabet Inc. and Apple Inc., gave a lackluster revenue forecast for the current quarter, suggesting that the AI spending frenzy isn’t as strong as some investors anticipated.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: The Broadcom Inc. headquarters in San Jose, California, US, on Monday, June 2, 2025. Broadcom Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on June 5.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Hands-On: Bigger Screen, Faster Chip Live Up to the Hype
item.description: The arrival of Nintendo Co.’s Switch 2 marks the biggest consumer tech product release of 2025 so far, with legions of gamers now unboxing and trying the new $450 gaming console for the first time.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Nintendo Switch 2.

item.title: Crypto Fund Takes Aim at Circle IPO For Ignoring Crypto Natives
item.description: Not everyone was celebrating the success of Circle Internet Group Inc.’s initial public offering on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Olga Kharif

media:content.media:description: Circle Internet Financial Ltd. signage during the company's initial public offering (IPO) on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. Circle shares surged as much as 235% after the company and some of its shareholders raised nearly $1.1 billion in an initial public offering that was upsized twice amid strong demand.

item.title: Bloomberg Tech Summit Special | Bloomberg Technology 6/5/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Technology hits the road with Ed Ludlow and Caroline Hyde live from the Tech Summit in San Francisco. They speak with Anduril Executive Chairman Trae Stephens about the company's latest fundraise and the future of defense tech, Agility Robotics CEO Peggy Johnson about her outlook for the robotics industry, and they hear from Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai on AI competition on the horizon. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Microsoft Hits First Record Since July as AI Halo Takes Hold
item.description: Microsoft Corp. shares closed at a record on Thursday, taking out an all-time high that’s stood for nearly a year as investors increasingly see the software giant as a major winner with artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: A Microsoft store in New York.

item.title: Walmart Boosts Drone Deliveries in Effort to Speed Up Orders
item.description: Walmart Inc. is adding drone delivery in five new cities in a bid to expand online sales and get goods to shoppers faster.
item.dc:creator: Jaewon Kang

media:content.media:description: A drone carries a Walmart delivery to a customer.

item.title: Perplexity AI CEO Pans Google’s AI Rollout and Assistant Product
item.description: Perplexity AI Inc. Chief Executive Officer Aravind Srinivas issued a broadside against Google’s artificial intelligence products and strategy, marking some of the AI search startup’s strongest criticisms of its rival.
item.dc:creator: Seth Fiegerman

media:content.media:description: Aravind Srinivas

item.title: The Evolution of Drones in Warfare
item.description: Quantum Systems CEO Florian Seibel talks about the evolution of using drones in modern warfare. He says drones have let Ukraine level the playing field in their war against Russia. The German company specializes in making drones and aerial intelligence. He says the US and Europe need to be able to build thousands of drones. He speaks to Bloomberg Businessweek. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Senate to Keep Spectrum Sales in Tax Bill, Key Republican Says
item.description: A key Republican said senators have reached an agreement to reauthorize spectrum sales to internet companies that would generate billions of dollars in revenue toward funding US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax cuts and spending bill.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC.

item.title: A Big, Pending Case Unites and Divides the Music Industry Over Fraud in Streaming
item.description: The music world is still debating over who should be responsible for cracking down on bogus streaming activity
item.dc:creator: Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: An auctioneer holds a gavel arranged following an auction of a residential property in the Paddington suburb of Sydney, Australia, on Saturday, Feb. 20, 2021. Australia's housing market is booming again, with the biggest monthly price gain in 17 years dispelling fears of a Covid-induced downturn. Photographer: Brent Lewin/Bloomberg

item.title: Rivian CEO Scaringe on China Tensions, Spinoff of Also
item.description: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe discusses the impact of the Trump administration's tariffs on the electric-vehicle industry and Rivian's spinoff of its micromobility business Also at the Bloomberg Tech Summit in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Portugal Says It May Reach 2% Defense Spending Target in 2025
item.description: Portugal will try to reach its defense spending target of 2% of gross domestic product in 2025, four years ahead of its initial goal, Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said.
item.dc:creator: Henrique Almeida

media:content.media:description: Luis Montenegro, Portugal's prime minister and leader of the Democratic Alliance party (AD), speaks during an election night rally at the party headquarter in Lisbon, Portugal, on Sunday, May 18, 2025. Portugal will hold an early election on Sunday, its third in just three years, after parliament toppled the prime minister’s center-right minority government in a confidence vote on March 11.

item.title: Peloton CEO Says He Has No Interest in Selling the Company
item.description: Peloton Interactive Inc. Chief Executive Officer Peter Stern said he has no interest in selling the business while he works on a turnaround, vowing to keep it “a standalone company.”
item.dc:creator: Samantha Kelly

media:content.media:description: Peter Stern, president and chief executive officer of Peloton Interactive Inc., during the Bloomberg Tech conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. The event brings together leaders across tech and business to discuss how executives, entrepreneurs and investors can navigate the hazards and multiply the opportunities in today’s landscape.
